intro: Astephanus gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's stephanus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
